Create Node.js apps using SQL Server on SLES

1 Set up your environment
2 Create Node.js application with SQL server
3 Make your Node.js app up to 100x faster

Step 1.1 Install SQL Server

Note: To ensure optimal performance of SQL Server, your machine should have at least 4 GB of memory.

  1. Register the Microsoft Linux repository and add they keys
sudo zypper addrepo -fc https://packages.microsoft.com/config/sles/12/mssql-server.repo
sudo zypper --gpg-auto-import-keys refresh
  1. Install SQL Server
sudo zypper update
sudo zypper install mssql-server
  1. Setup your SQL Server
sudo /opt/mssql/bin/mssql-conf setup

Microsoft(R) SQL Server(R) Setup

To abort setup at anytime, press Ctrl-C.

The license terms for this product can be downloaded from http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=746388 and
found in /usr/share/doc/mssql-server/LICENSE.TXT.

Do you accept the license terms? If so, please type YES:
Please enter a password for the system administrator (SA) account:
Please confirm the password for the system administrator (SA) account:

You now have SQL Server running locally on RHEL machine! Check out the next section to continue installing prerequisites.

Step 1.2 Install Node.ks

To install the Node.js package, you first need to enable the Web and Scripting module in the subscription.

    sudo zypper in -t patch SUSE-SLE-Module-Web-Scripting-12-2015-427=1

Install Node.js by updating the repository lists and then installing the nodejs6 package.

    sudo zypper refresh
    sudo zypper install nodejs6

You can verify your Node.js installation using this command:

  node -v

v.6.9.5

You now have Node.js installed! The next section will walk you through getting the tools to interact with your database.

Step 1.3 Install the ODBC Driver and SQL Command Line Utility for SQL Server

SQLCMD is a command line tool that enables you to connect to SQL Server and run queries.

sudo su
zypper ar https://packages.microsoft.com/config/sles/12/prod.repo
zypper update
exit
sudo ACCEPT_EULA=Y zypper install msodbcsql mssql-tools
sudo zypper install unixODBC-devel
echo 'export PATH="$PATH:/opt/mssql-tools/bin"' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export PATH="$PATH:/opt/mssql-tools/bin"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

Run a basic query.

sqlcmd -S localhost -U sa -P yourpassword -Q "SELECT @@VERSION"

--------------------------------------------------------
Microsoft SQL Server vNext (CTP1.3) - 14.0.304.100 (X64)
Feb  8 2017 04:21:38
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation
on Linux (Ubuntu 16.04)

1 rows(s) returned

Executed in 1 ns

You have successfully installed SQL Server Command Line Utilities on your SLES machine!

You have successfully installed SQL Server Command Line Utilities on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server. You now have everything you need to start writing Node.js apps with SQL Server!

Go to step 2
